docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Marine Safety (Alcohol and Drugs) (Approved Instrument Types and Specified Tests) Notice

section.name: s2
section.heading: Types of instruments approved for analyzing proportion of alcohol in specimen of breath
section.content: The types of instruments approved under section 46(1)(a) of the Ordinance for analyzing the proportion of alcohol in a specimen of breath are set out in Schedule 1.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Types of instruments approved for indicating whether proportion of alcohol in person’s breath is likely to exceed limit
section.content: The types of instruments approved under section 46(1)(b) of the Ordinance for indicating whether the proportion of alcohol in a person’s breath is likely to exceed the prescribed limit are set out in Schedule 2.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Types of instruments approved for detecting presence of specified illicit drug in person’s oral fluid
section.content: The types of instruments approved under section 46(1)(c) of the Ordinance for detecting the presence of any specified illicit drug in a person’s oral fluid are set out in Schedule 3.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Types of instruments approved for detecting presence of specified illicit drug in person’s urine
section.content: The types of instruments approved under section 46(1)(d) of the Ordinance for detecting the presence of any specified illicit drug in a person’s urine are set out in Schedule 4.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Marine Field Sobriety Test
section.content: The tests specified under section 46(2) of the Ordinance are set out in Schedule 5.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Types of Instruments Approved for Analyzing Proportion of Alcohol in Specimen of Breath

section.name: s1
section.content: SAF’IR Evolution manufactured by Alcohol Countermeasure Systems Corp., Toronto, Canada

section.name: s2
section.content: Alcotest 9510 manufactured by Dräger Safety AG & Co. KGaA, Lübeck, Germany

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Types of Instruments Approved for Indicating Whether Proportion of Alcohol in Person’s Breath is Likely to Exceed Limit

section.name: s1
section.content: SAF’IR Evolution manufactured by Alcohol Countermeasure Systems Corp., Toronto, Canada

section.name: s2
section.content: Alcotest 9510 manufactured by Dräger Safety AG & Co. KGaA, Lübeck, Germany

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Types of Instruments Approved for Detecting Presence of Specified Illicit Drug in Person’s Oral Fluid

section.name: s1
section.content: A drug wipe, known as DrugWipe®6S, manufactured by Securetec Detektions-Systeme AG, Germany

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Types of Instruments Approved for Detecting Presence of Specified Illicit Drug in Person’s Urine

section.name: s1
section.content: Drugs of Abuse Test Cups manufactured by Xiamen Boson Biotech Co., Ltd.

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Tests Included in Marine Field Sobriety Test

section.name: s1
section.content: General Questions, to test a person’s mental state

section.name: s2
section.content: Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Test, to indicate the effects of drugs on a person’s nervous system

section.name: s3
section.content: Finger to Nose Test, to test a person’s depth perception and ability to process instructions

section.name: s4
section.content: Palm Pat Test, to test a person’s coordination and ability to count out loud according to instructions

section.name: s5
section.content: Hand Coordination Test, to test a person’s ability to process instructions
